result.execSummary:
The defendant Jorian D Bruce was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Conceal (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Retail Theft (<=$500)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with the co-defendants - Antonio Galmore and Brendon McCord.

Defendant shall have no direct or indirect contact with any Fleet Farm store in Washington County.

Defendant shall not possess any firearm or ammunition.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.
Court authorizes transfer to Milwaukee County Jail.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Lauria Ann Lynch-German.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Clerk: CP.  Def missed court this morning thinking his hearing was at 1:30pm.  Agreement reached.  Court questions State and counsel.  State moves to dismiss and read-in Ct 2; Court so orders.  Def enters guilty plea to Ct 1.  Court finds def guilty on Ct 1.  Statements from State, counsel and def.  Court proceeds to sentencing.
